description: Variation (S73) of conditions 2 (approved plans) and 8 (number of retail units) of planning permission PP/2012/0699 dated 01/05/2014, as amended by permission ref. PP/2015/6090 dated 01/08/2016, for construction of a part single part two and part three storey rear extension to public house; alterations to frontage; construction of an attached part single part three storey building at 1-3 South Road; to accommodate four retail units and associated storage at ground floor and basement levels; and 6 residential units on the upper floors. Variation seeks five retail units at ground floor level, modification to layout of upper floor residential flats, and development to be carried out in accordance with the revised plan drawings
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date extant full planning permission ref: PP/2012/0699 dated 01/05/2013.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers GBA/11/47/1, 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 (Received 22/02/2012), GBA/11/47/3, 4, 5 and 6 (Received 21/11/2012); GBA/11/47/34f, 36, 37, 50 and 51 (Received 19/03/2013); GBA/11/47/35g, and 52 (Received 15/04/2013); GBA/11/47/32h (Received 28/05/2013)
Planning Ref PP/2015/6090:
Planning Ref 165696VAR:

1604_PL_029 - Basement Plan Proposed Layout; 1604_PL_030 - Ground Floor Plan Proposed Layout; 1604_PL_31 - First Floor Plan Proposed Layout; 1604_PL_032 - Second Floor Plan Proposed Layout; 1604_PL_033 - Roof Plan Proposed; 1604_PL_034 - Elevation 1 Proposed; 1604_PL_035 - Elevation 2 Proposed; 1604_PL_036 - Elevation 3 Proposed; 1604_PL_038 - Elevation 6 Proposed; 1604_PL_039 - Elevation 8 & 9 Proposed; 1604_PL_040 - Elevation 11 Proposed
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Ensure the materials and finishes to be used for the external surfaces of the development are carried out in accordance with the discharge of condition approval ref. 165128CND dated 08 December 2016.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 7.1 and 7.6 of the adopted London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(h) of Ealing Development (Core) Strategy Development Plan Document (2012) and policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Ensure the shopfronts and doorways to the ground floor of the Locally Listed Building and retention/removal of internal features are carried out in accordance with the discharge of condition approval ref. 165357CND dated 15 March 2017.

Reason: To preserve the character and appearance of the Locally Listed Building in accordance with policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the adopted London Plan (2015), policy 1.1(h), 1.2(g) and 2.1(C) of Ealing Development (Core) Strategy Development Plan Document (2012) and policy 7.4, 7B and 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
| Ensure the site construction method statement and management plan is carried out in accordance with the discharge of condition approval ref. 165358CND dated 08 March 2017.

Reason: To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 6.3, 6.11 and 7.14 of the adopted London Plan (2015) and policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Ensure the delivery/servicing operational management plan is carried out in accordance with the discharge of condition approval ref. 165359CND dated 02 February 2017.  The areas shown on the approved plans as a refuse storage area shall be kept clear, as required, during servicing periods and shall not be used for other purpose.

Reason: In the interests of highway/pedestrian safety and an appropriate operation of the development in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.A, of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The cycle parking storage hereby approved shall be made fully available prior to the first use of the development, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided in order to encourage the use of sustainable modes of transport and to reduce the reliance by staff travelling to school by car in the interests of the conditions of general highway safety and the free flow of traffic on the neighbouring highway in accordance with policy 6.9 and in the London Plan (2015), policy 1.1 (f) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and the Supplementary Planning Document 'Sustainable Transport for New Development' (2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the schedule of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 2005, or in any provision equivalent to that class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), the five commercial units for A1 use hereby approved shall not be amalgamated/subdivided.

Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the vitality and viability of the Southall Town Centre, in accordance with section 2 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 2.13, 2.15, 2.16, 4.1, 4.7 and 4.8 of The London Plan (2015), policy 1.1 (a) (c) (d), 1.2 (c), 2.1 (c), 2.8 (c) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy and policy 4B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | The retail shops hereby approved shall be used for retail use only (A1 use class) and for no other purposes within the schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended), without the prior written permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use in the interests of the function of the town centre in accordance with policies 2.15, 4.7, 4.8 and 4.9 of The London Plan (2015) and the Ealing Core Strategy (2012). | The retail units hereby approved shall not operate outside the hours of 07:00 - 23:00hrs Mondays to Saturdays, and 08:00 - 22:00hrs on Sundays and Public Holidays, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of local residents in accordance with section 4 and 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.11, 6.13, 7.1, 7.4 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015) and policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Deliveries / collections (Including refuse collection) at the proposed development shall only take place during the period 1000 - 1600 hrs and 1900 -2100 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays.

Reason: In the interests of highway/pedestrian safety and an appropriate operation of the development in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.A, of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The development hereby approved shall comply with 'Secured by Design' standards.

Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder and to improve pedestrian accessibility in accordance with policies 4.1, & 4.3 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2015). | Ensure the mitigation measures that would be incorporated into the development to comply with current standards to protect habitable spaces fronting onto High Street/South Road are carried out in accordance with the discharge of condition approval ref. 165362CND dated 02 March 2017.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with SPG 10 - 'Noise and Vibration', policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for the installation of a filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides and particulate matter in the external air to serve the residential units hereby approved. The details to be submitted shall include the arrangements for continuously maintaining the operational efficiency of the system. The ventilation system as approved shall be completed prior to first occupation of any of the residential units and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with SPG 10 - 'Noise and Vibration', policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from any plant/machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with SPG 10 - 'Noise and Vibration', policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Ensure the floor/ceiling separating the commercial from the residential accommodation in relation to being resistant to the passage of smoke and fumes and that the insulation is sufficient to prevent noise disturbance is carried out in accordance with the discharge of condition approval ref. 165364CND dated 02 February 2017.

Reason: To prevent nuisance in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the residential element of the proposed development in accordance with section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, SPG 10 - 'Noise and Vibration', policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Ensure the hard and soft landscaping is carried out in accordance with discharge of condition approval ref. 165367CND dated 29 November 2016.  The approved details shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the commencement of the development or such other period as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with section 11 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7.4 of the London Plan (2015) and policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Ensure the Arboricultural Method Statement for the protection of existing tree off site (located within curtilage of no. 4 High Street) is carried out in accordance with discharge approval ref. 165368CND) dated 08 December 2016.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.

Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with section 11 of the National Planning Policy Framework, the objectives of policies 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'.

| Ensure the foundation structure/s, of the approved building, designed to minimise their adverse impact on tree referred to in condition 17, including the tree survey, arboricultural impact assessment and arboricultural statement are carried out in accordance with discharge of condition approval ref. 165748CND dated 21 December 2016.

Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with section 11 of the National Planning Policy Framework, the objectives of policies 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'.
| All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to the lifetime homes standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with SPG 7, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.2 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details of sustainable design and construction and energy efficiency measures for the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority, prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed prior to the first occupation of the flats hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained and maintained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to climate change mitigation requirements in accordance with the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 5.1 and 5.3 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
